issue.title: [CF 1093] Possible to evaluate keypress as condition?
issue.body:
I have been looking all day to see if there is an easy way to evaluate a condition based on a keypress?

Say for example I have a set with a keybind of ctrl+F for a spell to cast in a rotation. If I do not want to check to see if the spell is cast but if I managed to press the appropriate keybinding is that possible?

This would help to enable a notification so I could see on screen that I am not fat fingering keys. The main reason I am doing this is to train myself in new key presses in a sort of screen flash/Pavlovian way.

So What I see is Lua (advanced) as an option but it is messing with my head because I can't see an easy way to add scripting for an onkeyup or onkeydown logic check.

While I can use a mod: command in the macro part, I do not want to solely monitor a modifier key as that would trigger whenever I hold down said key (such as CTRL) and that wouldn't evaluate the condition of the key combo I want (CTRL + F) for example.
